confession.devil_appearance: illusion in the form of a man
confession.seduction_context: Angry because son-in-law took some money she had. Was about to go into room to sleep when approached by devil promising to give her money if she would believe in him
sabbat_activities: doing homage to devil as if he were God

testimony.quarrel_subject: His wife told Mariette to keep away from reaping and that it would be better if she helped put goods in rather than gleaning
Witness objected to Mariette moving to village due to her reputation, saying it would not be good near a poor laborer who had already suffered many losses

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 2 days after gleaning incident; 3 weeks after confrontation about witches

testimony.quarrel_subject: Father Pieron Boulengier suspected Mariette was stealing flour from him at mill
Mariette asked him to plead her case before prévôt when she wanted to come and live at Amance; he refused

witnesses.name: Philippe femme Melchior Bryant
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor; husband Claude Tisselat dit Malfourby was her uncle

testimony.quarrel_subject: Mariette complained that witness had spoken against her brother-in-law Claude Gerard (untrue); also husband refused to speak for her

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: following his refusal to speak for her

witnesses.name: Demenge Mengeot
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor at mill; provided food during guard duty

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute about borrowed bucket seized as part of goods, and plates and 'franges de fillet' his wife bought at sale of goods
testimony.threat_quote: que mal proffict il en puisse faire

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: shortly afterwards; died 3 weeks before testimony

timeline.subject: Mariette veuve Claude Malfourby
timeline.details: PG (C.M. Rémy) requests question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Mariette veuve Claude Malfourby
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves with moderation suitable to her age

timeline.subject: Mariette veuve Claude Malfourby
timeline.details: First torture session - confessed nothing despite thumbscrews, rack, and strappado

timeline.subject: Mariette veuve Claude Malfourby
timeline.details: Goaler informed judges she wanted to confess - confessed to 5 years as witch, seduction by Persy, attending sabbat 2-3 times

timeline.subject: Mariette veuve Claude Malfourby
timeline.details: Confirmed confessions, explained why she didn't harm son-in-law

timeline.subject: Mariette veuve Claude Malfourby
timeline.details: Change de Nancy asks for renewed torture about malefices and accomplices

timeline.subject: Mariette veuve Claude Malfourby
timeline.details: Second torture session - confessed to killing Demange Mengeot's younger daughter, 6 pigs, and a horse belonging to son-in-law

timeline.subject: Mariette veuve Claude Malfourby
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

timeline.subject: Mariette veuve Claude Malfourby
timeline.details: Formal death sentence from court at Amance

torture.restrictions: with moderation suitable to her age

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne femme Claude Ferquel
notable_quotes.french: et qu'il vauldroit mieux qu'elle ayt a ayder a mettre les biens dedans que d'ainsy glanner
notable_quotes.english: and it would be better if she helped put goods in rather than gleaning
notable_quotes.context: To Mariette during harvest gleaning incident

notable_quotes.speaker: Mariette to Jeanne Ferquel
notable_quotes.context: Mariette's reaction after being told to stop gleaning

notable_quotes.speaker: Mariette about Jeanne's illness
notable_quotes.french: que ladite malade n'en mourrait, et que ce n'estoit une maladie pour en mourir
notable_quotes.english: that the said sick woman would not die from it, and that it was not an illness to die from

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne femme Claude Ferquel to Mariette
notable_quotes.french: que souvent elle avoit tenu tels propos, et que telle maladies provenoit de sorcieres et mauvaises gens qui luy faisoient de mal assez, mais que dieu avoit pitié d'elle et de ses enffantz
notable_quotes.english: that often she had said such things, and that such illnesses came from witches and evil people who did her enough harm, but that God had pity on her and her children

notable_quotes.speaker: Izabel veuve Didier Barizien recounting Mariette's sleep talk
notable_quotes.french: par le non des, va t'en, sy tu es bien sage ne t'y retrouve plus
notable_quotes.english: by the name of, go away, if you are wise don't come back again

notable_quotes.speaker: Izabel recounting Mariette's sleep talk
notable_quotes.french: Oye l'espaulle, que tu ne charge ceste espaulle
notable_quotes.english: Oh the shoulder, don't burden this shoulder
notable_quotes.context: Mariette talking in sleep by fire

notable_quotes.speaker: Mariette to Izabel
notable_quotes.french: sy elle n'avoit esté et tous les diables avec elle
notable_quotes.english: if she had not been there with all the devils
notable_quotes.context: About not fearing being incriminated by la Vilaume

notable_quotes.speaker: Mariette to Izabel
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle n'alloit en pas un lieux qu'elle n'y entende quelque fresche nouvelles
notable_quotes.english: that she couldn't go anywhere without hearing some fresh news
notable_quotes.context: Returning home in evening with head in apron

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Mengeot recounting Mariette's words
notable_quotes.french: que mal proffict il en puisse faire
notable_quotes.english: that evil profit he may make from it
notable_quotes.context: Threat after refusing to return bucket and goods

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine femme Demenge Mengeot recounting Mariette
Mariette during confession
notable_quotes.french: il estoit assez galant pour la faire prendre
notable_quotes.english: he was gallant enough to have her arrested
notable_quotes.context: Explaining why she didn't stay long at sabbat - feared son-in-law would notice

relationships.evidence_text: Her uncle Claude Tisselat dit Malfourby (her husband)
lived with her as she did before her arrest
sieur Dattel, their master at time

economic_context.details: Dispute over borrowed bucket seized as part of goods. Wife of Demenge Mengeot bought plates and 'franges de fillet' at sale of goods which Mariette wanted returned. Son-in-law took money from Mariette which angered her and led to alleged seduction. Suspicion of theft of flour from mill. Mariette worked as day laborer and gleaner, indicating poverty.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fell ill, falling to the ground several times, thought to be on point of death, confessed and received sacraments. Began to convalesce then had further illness, still in very bad state
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Wife told Mariette to keep away from reaping during gleaning

harms_catalog.harm_description: Second illness lasting 2 days after gleaning incident
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness objected to Mariette moving to village

harms_catalog.harm_description: Third illness, thought she would die. Mariette wanted to make her bed saying she would not die
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: After confronting Mariette about witches causing illness

harms_catalog.harm_description: Found dead little way past stream with no mark on body, day after being healthy
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Suspected Mariette was stealing flour from him at mill

harms_catalog.harm_description: Illness that kept him in bed for 10 weeks, unable to sleep or rest for 5 of these
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to plead her case before prévôt when she wanted to come live at Amance

harms_catalog.harm_description: Illness following his refusal to speak for her
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Husband refused to speak for her; witness also allegedly spoke against brother-in-law
Son-in-law gave him supper then fell down as if dead

harms_catalog.harm_description: Illness beginning in arm then through whole body. Tumours appeared on back, turned into hump, all twisted and in pain, unable to find healing
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute about bucket and goods purchased at sale

harms_catalog.harm_description: Illness beginning in throat and behind ears, languished for long time, died 3 weeks before testimony, reduced to skin and bone
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute about bucket and goods purchased at sale
harms_catalog.method_alleged: touch - touched under chin; grey powder (per confession)

harms_catalog.victim_name: Children of Demenge and Catherine Mengeot
harms_catalog.harm_description: Children frightened when she touched them, complained she had red eyes
harms_catalog.method_alleged: touch - one on arm, other under chin

harms_catalog.victim_name: Horse belonging to son-in-law Nicolas Martin

material_culture.context: Wife was reaping oats during gleaning incident
Reaping grain when saw Mariette followed by black dog
Devil Persy gave her two cornets of paper which turned out to be empty
Used to kill younger daughter of Demange Mengeot and animals
Devil gave her powder in fields which she threw away

Bought at sale of goods, dispute over return
Bought at sale of goods, dispute over return
Mariette allegedly righted overturned cart unaided
Son-in-law hit her with barrel lid causing bruised face
Pieron Boulengier drank wine at Dumont and mill before death
Pieron Boulengier arranged for milling of corn
Suspected of stealing flour from mill
Mariette washed face with holy water and sprinkled on breast to keep devil away
Jeanne Ferquel received sacraments when thought to be dying
Son-in-law took money from Mariette, angering her before seduction
Mariette wanted to make Jeanne's bed during illness

Where Mariette was going to see son-in-law when followed by black dog
Home of witness Bietrix femme François Thierion
Home of witnesses Demenge and Catherine Mengeot
Where Pieron Boulengier went on day of death and drank wine
Where Mariette lived with daughter and son-in-law; where Pieron stopped; subject of guard duty
Where Pieron Boulengier was found dead on other side
Where devil Persy appeared and gave powder; where reaping occurred
Where Mariette would wash face with holy water to keep devil away
Where Mariette attended sabbat 2-3 times - on foot by day, everyone masked, dancing
Location of Change de Nancy court that approved sentences

economic_hardship_indicators: Mariette working as gleaner (customary for poor)
Mariette worked as day laborer to gain honest living
Jeanne Ferquel described as 'poor laborer who had already suffered many losses'
Dispute over small items like bucket and plates
Mariette feared daughter and grandson would die of hunger if son-in-law killed

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Goaler informed judges when she wanted to confess

change_de_nancy.modification_details: First torture approved with moderation suitable to her age (24 Feb 1616); requested renewed torture about malefices and accomplices (12 March 1616); approved death sentence (15 March 1616)

hearsay_chains.content: Mariette's prediction that wife would not die
Mariette told la Bariziere she could not drive dog off
Mariette had heard what Jeanne said about her and was not content
Several times heard him say she was a witch, alleging cart incident
General reputation from son-in-law who said she was witch 'des plus maitresses'
Had heard she was a witch since childhood
Uncle regretted marrying into such family; Mariette's father only escaped burning because he died
Son-in-law told how cart overturned then she righted it unaided
Son-in-law complained of Mariette causing pig deaths and called her witch
Had often heard son-in-law call her witch

emotional_state_notes: Left gleaning 'en grondant et fort murmurant' (grumbling and murmuring strongly)
Head in apron when returning home in evening
Became very fearful after arrest of la Vilaume
Nevertheless expressed regret at having renounced God, and asked to be put to death for her faults

third_parties.name: la Vilaume
third_parties.context: Already arrested, had accused Mariette; Mariette feared being incriminated by her

third_parties.name: Nicolas Martin
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: source of hearsay for multiple witnesses
third_parties.context: Miller; called Mariette witch; maltreated her; took her money; allegedly had pigs and horse killed; spied on her and would have had her arrested if he noticed sabbat attendance

third_parties.name: Pieron Boulengier
third_parties.context: Found dead day after visiting mill and Dumont, with no mark on body

third_parties.name: sieur Dattel
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: master of Claude and Jeanne Ferquel
third_parties.context: Told Jeanne Ferquel about Mariette coming to be new neighbor

third_parties.name: la Bariziere
third_parties.context: Told Jeanne Ferquel that Mariette heard what she said; Mariette told her about black dog

third_parties.name: Claude Tisselat dit Malfourby
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: uncle of Philippe femme Melchior Bryant
third_parties.context: Regretted marrying into witch family

third_parties.name: Mariette's father
third_parties.context: Reputed witch; only escaped being burned because he died

third_parties.name: Mariette's mother
third_parties.context: Mariette said was not a witch

third_parties.name: Mariette's grandmother
third_parties.context: Was burned as witch

third_parties.name: Mariette's sister
third_parties.context: Strongly reputed to be witch

third_parties.name: Claude Gerard
third_parties.context: Mariette complained Philippe had spoken against him (untrue)

third_parties.name: Bastien Conta
third_parties.context: Husband of tante Barbe; something 'bransloit' since Mariette went to Lanfroicourt

third_parties.name: tante Barbe femme Bastien Conta
third_parties.context: Something 'bransloit' since Mariette went to Lanfroicourt

third_parties.name: Daughter of Mariette
third_parties.context: Wife of Nicolas Martin; Mariette didn't want her and grandson to die of hunger

third_parties.context: Mariette didn't want him to die of hunger

third_parties.context: Called subjects to guard mill

third_parties.name: Daughter aged 9 of Demenge Mengeot

third_parties.name: Daughter aged 3 of Demenge Mengeot
third_parties.context: Died 3 weeks before testimony, reduced to skin and bone, after Mariette touched her

third_parties.name: Persy (devil)
third_parties.context: Seduced Mariette 5 years before; appeared as man; gave empty cornets of paper and powder; sought consent to kill

third_parties.name: 2 women already executed (unnamed)

third_parties.context: Sent to escort Pieron Boulengier past stream

extraction_metadata.notes: This is trial record labeled as 'Witch 139' but appears in archive as w008. Very detailed testimony with extensive witness statements, confession under torture, and multiple procedural stages. Notable elements include: family history of witchcraft (grandmother burned, father and sister reputed), black dog familiar incident, son-in-law repeatedly calling her witch, supernatural strength (righting cart), sleep-talking incidents, multiple harm allegations, and confession to attending sabbat while avoiding sexual relations with devil. Confession obtained only after second torture session. The trial shows classic patterns of reputation evidence, quarrel-harm sequences, and torture-induced confession.
